title: All Treasury maturities under 2%
text:
@Win1177 wrote:

Maybe the bond market is trying to tell us something???

Treasury bond yields are down (1.45% for 10 yr) because of distortions in foreign bond yields, e.g., 10 yr bund yield is -0.60%. 25% of sovereign debt, $16 T, has negative yields which is why foreign investors are buying up US treasuries with 2% yield on 30 yr bond.

EU countries are relying on monetary policy to grow their economies by issuing bonds with negative rates instead of changing labor policies to reduce high unemployment, E.g., 8% in France. German budget has a 2% surplus each year but Germany will not spend some of it on stimulus to reduce recession risk due to declining exports of cars to China and rest of the world.

All bond market is telling us is that investors cannot get 2% yield anywhere else in the global markets.
